meanings.definition: To make a mistake or error in judgment.
meanings.sent1: I always seem to mismet when trying to bake cookies.
meanings.sent2: She mismet the directions and ended up getting lost.
meanings.sent3: The cat mismet by thinking the fishbowl was a new bed.
meanings.sent4: His heart mismet when he thought he had missed the last train.
meanings.sent5: The student's face showed pure shock when he mismet the answer during the test.

meanings.definition: A mistake or error in judgment.
meanings.sent1: Making a mismet can lead to valuable lessons learned.
meanings.sent2: The mismet in the report caused a delay in the project.
meanings.sent3: The mismatched socks were a funny mismet in her outfit.
meanings.sent4: The decision to trust him was a mismet she regretted deeply.
meanings.sent5: The mismet in the recipe turned the cake into a disaster.
